en.index-header-subtitle: I create simple, functional, and meaningful websites. Take a look at what Iâ€™ve made so far! ğŸ‘‡
en.index-about-cv: Hi! Iâ€™m a second-year Information Technology student at the Faculty of Education, Charles University. ğŸ“ I have experience creating websites using HTML and CSS, from school projects to small personal pages. ğŸŒ Iâ€™m comfortable with MS Office and have a basic understanding of Python. ğŸ I enjoy learning new things, working carefully, and meeting deadlines. âœ¨ I can help with simple static website creation, HTML/CSS tweaks, and basic content management. ğŸ’» Iâ€™m a native Czech speaker and fluent in English (B2/C1). ğŸŒ

en.about-aside-interests6: Lead Methodologist of the gamified educational platform JukeBOX
en.about-part1: My name is Jan, and Iâ€™m currently a second-year student of Information Technology at the Faculty of Education, Charles University. Iâ€™ve been interested in computers and technology since I was a kid â€” Iâ€™ve always been fascinated by how things work, what can be changed or improved, and why things look the way they do. ğŸ’»
en.about-part2: Gaming ğŸ® has been a big part of my life from early on. For me, games are more than just entertainment â€” theyâ€™re a way to relax, unwind, and escape from reality for a while. Thanks to gaming, Iâ€™ve learned a lot of English ğŸ‡¬ğŸ‡§, and with games like Path of Exile, I really enjoy the strategy and thinking behind them. Sometimes, thereâ€™s just nothing better than turning everything off, opening a game, and getting lost in another world. ğŸ˜„
en.about-part3: Since elementary school, Iâ€™ve been playing tennis ğŸ¾ â€” my parents and grandparents guided me toward competitive play, so I trained seriously and gradually went through all the categories from young players up to adults. For a while, I even played for two towns on weekends â€“ ZruÄ nad SÃ¡zavou (youth) and LedeÄ nad SÃ¡zavou (adults). In high school, I was probably in the best shape of my life â€” my friend and I trained five to seven times a week.
en.about-part4: After graduation, I went to a Higher Vocational School focused on Business Economics and Management. I originally wanted to study IT, but I didnâ€™t get in at the time, so I chose this path instead â€” and it turned out to be a valuable experience. During my internship, I worked with CZECH.UP z.s., an organization focused on gamified education, where we created educational online courses on topics like cybersecurity and financial literacy.
en.about-part5: In my internship evaluation, it was noted that I was considered a co-author of several projects, and I also earned a certificate as Lead Methodologist of the CZECH.UP JukeBox Platform for Gamified Learning. During this time, I led a team of students and friends in a project about financial literacy in cooperation with ÄŒPP, and I also took part in international collaboration where CZECH.UP (CZ) worked together with partners from Slovakia ğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡°, Italy ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡¹, and Spain ğŸ‡ªğŸ‡¸. This experience taught me communication, leadership, and how to work effectively online. ğŸŒ
en.about-part6: After successfully completing my studies, I passed my final exams in Economics, Accounting, Management, Costing, and English, and earned the DiS. title (Certified Specialist) â€” with honors! ğŸ“ Of course, my friends and I â€” the same group who studied together for three years â€” had to celebrate properly ğŸ», and even though we donâ€™t see each other as often now, we still keep in touch.
en.about-part7: Shortly after returning from a family vacation, I received an email that completely changed my plans â€” I was accepted to Charles University to study Information Technology with a focus on education, a field I had wanted to pursue for a long time. And it was there that I discovered what truly excites me â€” web development. ğŸ–¥ï¸
en.about-part8: In my first year, I enrolled in an optional course called Web Development, where I learned the basics of HTML and CSS and built my first website â€” Custom Project Company, which you can find in the Projects & News section. Thatâ€™s where it all began.
en.about-part9: Now, in my second year, Iâ€™m taking the course again â€” but this time as a mandatory subject with a broader scope. Since all of us have already built websites before, we go through HTML and CSS faster, so we can spend more time on JavaScript, databases, and MySQL.
en.about-part10: I really enjoy working with websites â€” from designing layouts and tuning colors to writing the code itself. I like when everything fits together naturally and the result looks clean and balanced. âœ¨ I always meet deadlines, Iâ€™m reliable, and communication with me is easy â€” I usually reply within a few minutes. ğŸ˜„
en.about-part11: In my free time, I love to play games ğŸ® â€” gaming has been a big part of my life for years and still is. Sometimes I try out new things in HTML/CSS or do a bit of coding, but when Iâ€™m not creating, I like to watch Outdoor Boys, grab a beer ğŸº, and just relax. Iâ€™m also learning Python and experimenting with the Pygame library, where Iâ€™m slowly learning to make simple games â€” itâ€™s still more of an experiment, but I really enjoy it. ğŸ
en.about-part12: Iâ€™m truly grateful for the people around me â¤ï¸ â€” for my mom, who always supports me and does everything she can to make sure Iâ€™m happy ğŸŒ·, for my grandparents, who help and give me valuable advice ğŸ‘µğŸ‘´, and for my girlfriend, who supports me, believes in me, and stands by me even when I doubt myself. ğŸ’
en.about-part13: If you like my work, projects, or my story, feel free to reach out. Maybe we can create something together that perfectly fits your vision. ğŸ¤
en.projects-subtitle: Some of the websites Iâ€™ve built
en.projects-project1-info: Personal portfolio to start my journey as a web developer.
en.projects-project2-info: My first website created as a course assignment in the first semester.
en.services-h1: Websites Built with Simplicity and Clarity
en.services-subtitle: I focus on front-end only websites â€” clean HTML and CSS, without backend systems or complex JavaScript features.
en.services-intro: Here are the services I can offer to help bring your idea online.
en.services-service1-info: I create simple and reliable static websites using clean HTML and CSS. No unnecessary complexity â€” just clear structure, readable content, and visuals tailored to your needs. Each project is built carefully and individually, with room to grow over time.
en.services-service2-info: I always aim to make websites easy to use on different screen sizes, from computers to tablets and phones. As I continue improving my skills, I make sure the important content stays clear and accessible wherever your visitors come from.
en.services-service3-info: I listen to your ideas and work to create a design that fits your style and goals. My websites focus on clarity, warm tones, and a simple modern look that feels comfortable for users and reflects what you want to present.
en.services-service4-info: If you already have a website or template, I can help with small improvements â€” fixing layout issues, updating styles, refreshing colors or polishing the content. Even small adjustments can make your site feel more professional and user-friendly.
en.services-service5-info: From a single landing page to a full website with multiple sections or pages, I can help you present your idea clearly online. We keep things simple, easy to navigate and focused on what matters most to your visitors.
en.cpcompany-subtitle: My first website created for a course assigment
en.CPCdescription-part1: Custom Project Company is the very first website I ever created. It was developed as a final project in the Website Development course during the 1st semester of my Bachelorâ€™s studies at Charles University.
en.CPCdescription-part2: The goal was to build a simple multi-page website of our choice using HTML & CSS with SVG graphics, focusing on clear structure, functional navigation and a consistent visual style.
en.CPCdescription-part3: This project gave me my first real experience with transforming an idea into a working website and helped me understand key principles of web structure, layout, and frontend development basics.
en.CPC-tech-creation1: The project was created using fundamental web technologies such as HTML, CSS, and SVG. The main focus was to build a multi-page website with a clear structure, internal navigation, and consistent styling.
en.CPC-tech-creation2: During the development process, I worked on tasks like drawing shapes in SVG (e.g., a one-line house or simple flags), styling a chessboard layout using CSS, and practicing linking between pages to form a complete website.
en.CPC-tech-creation3: I also worked with essential web resources including W3Schools, Icons8, and online color palette tools, while occasionally using AI assistance to support coding and design decisions.
en.CPClearned1: As my very first real web project, this experience helped me understand how websites are built from scratch and how HTML, CSS and SVG technologies work together in practice.
en.CPClearned2: I gained confidence in writing clean and structured code, working with navigation, linking pages, inserting images and improving visual hierarchy. I also experimented beyond the course requirements by trying new elements and exploring solutions independently.
en.cpc-kt1: Understanding the fundamentals of HTML & CSS
en.cpc-kt2: Learning about SVG and experimenting with Inkscape
en.cpc-kt3: Adding and styling graphics, icons and custom elements
en.cpc-kt4: Building a multi-page project with consistent navigation
en.cpc-kt5: Improving visual structure and basic responsiveness
en.CPClearned3: Looking back, Iâ€™m proud of this project â€” it was a successful first step into the world of web development and a strong base for future growth.
en.PPortfolio-subtitle: My first fully self-directed web project â€” designed, built and optimized by myself.
en.PPdescription-part1: This is my second website, created after taking a break from coding and wanting to continue improving my skills in web development. I decided to build my own personal portfolio as a place to showcase my projects, present myself and make it easier for others to see my work and contact me.
en.PPdescription-part2: The purpose of this website is to serve as my professional online presence as I start exploring freelance opportunities. It is a platform I plan to keep updating and expanding as I continue learning, building new projects and growing as a web developer.
en.PP-tech-creation1: This project was developed using HTML, CSS, SVG and basic JavaScript (for language switching functionality). After a longer break from coding, I wanted to fully refresh and improve my frontend skills while building something meaningful and personal.
en.PP-tech-creation2: The initial idea was to create a simple portfolio that I could use on platforms like GitHub or freelance websites. However, the concept quickly evolved into a more complex personal website where I could present myself, my projects and future work in one place.
en.PP-tech-creation3: I started by sketching design ideas on paper, planning the layout and writing content for each section. Then I carefully built the website step by step â€” tag by tag â€” constantly revising, improving and fixing issues as I discovered them.
en.PPlearned1: Building my personal portfolio taught me a wide range of new web development skills. I worked with modern frontend techniques such as CSS Grid for layout structure, aspect-ratio for proper image scaling and improved semantic HTML for a more accessible and organized page structure.
en.PPlearned2: This was my first fully self-directed project â€” no predefined structure or design requirements. It taught me how to plan, design and build a web application from scratch while making many decisions independently and continuously improving the final result.
en.pp-kt1: Using favicons and understanding how browsers handle them
en.pp-kt2: Basic SEO (meta tags, page titles, keywords)
en.pp-kt3: CSS Grid, Flexbox and more advanced styling techniques
en.pp-kt4: Maintaining correct aspect ratios for web images
en.pp-kt5: Better handling of file paths, linking and project structure
en.pp-kt6: Basic JavaScript for dynamic content (language switcher)
en.gdpr-text: This website uses **functional Local Storage** to save your language preference. By continuing to browse, you agree to these preference files.
